children.subject: FWIW, I hated 61C and got a C in it because I struggled through it, but 162 was much more enjoyable and I ended up with an A in it. 162 does build upon some 61C concepts, but they're the more practical concepts and the course itself is a lot of fun if you have a solid project group to help you along.
For what it's worth, I didn't enjoy 61C but I enjoyed 162 much more. There are some topics from 61C than 162 covers as well, but I think 162 covers them in a much better way.

history.content: I'd say given your opinions on the courses, I'd say 162, 176, 186, and then honestly I'd recommend 161 or C100 over any of the rest. Unless you haven't had any internship experience, 169 isn't that useful from what I've heard. 188 is a fun course but if you're looking for applicability it's not that great unless you're going into something to do with AI. And if you're worried about not being prepared for 189 and don't really need it then don't take that. In my opinion, 161 was the most useful class in helping me learn how to write secure code. The concepts you learn about how easy it is to exploit systems can really help when you get to industry and need to write code for a critical piece of a company's product. C100 teaches applicable tools for data science, something that I think could benefit you specifically in biology.

children.subject: Bump. Really appreciate the responses, and I would like more opinions!
Does anyone know if 176 will be webcasted in fall 2019?

history.content:
Hello, MCB major/CS minor here.

I have two more semesters to plan, and I want to take 2 CS classes each semester. I'm just having a hard time deciding which classes would be the most helpful in getting a SWE job in biology after I graduate.

I know there have been a lot of posts concerning the best courses to take for SWE, but I am specific about courses best for SWE in biology. I just know I really like coding and biology, but I'm not sure what a job in those fields really entails, so I am struggling to pick courses.

Btw, I am taking CS 170 right now, so please don't recommend that.

Here are the courses I am considering:

CS 176 - I definitely want to take this one.

CS 186 - I like SQL, and I feel like this class is important.

CS 162 - I've heard this is important for SWE, but I am hesitant. From what I've read, it builds upon 61C concepts and I am not enjoying 61C right now.

CS 169 - Seems more relevant to SWE, but people say it's not necessary?

CS 188 - Considering this one because it might be relevant to bio?

CS 189 - This is a stretch, since I don't think I have enough background to succeed in this class.

Out of this list, which are the best 4 I should take?
history.subject: SWE in biology?
